items.title: https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-api/pull/200
items.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm Josep, the team lead for the polkadot-api project. I'd like to bring your attention to an exceptional contribution made in a [recent Pull Request](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-api/pull/200). This PR stands out because of its significant impact on dApp development, particularly in reducing the bundle sizes of dApp assets.

We understand the value of such contributions, as evidenced by our team's previous efforts. One of our team members spent a couple of days researching this issue, and while it was considered a "nice to have" rather than a high priority, our findings (detailed [here](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-api/issues/198#issuecomment-1825864550)) only scratched the surface. The work accomplished in this PR, however, has far surpassed our initial efforts.

Given the exceptional nature of this contribution, I strongly recommend that we offer a medium tip to the contributor. Such recognition not only rewards their hard work but also fosters a spirit of collaboration and excellence in our community.

Thank you for considering this request.

Best regards,
Josep

items.title: Returning submission deposit for RMRK in order to reject treasury proposal 222
items.content:
[Motion 341](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/motion/341) was a proposal submitted with the goal to fund the continued production of RMRK Substrate pallets: adaptable to the entire ecosystem. As it is accustomed with treasury proposals higher than 500k USD, this was submitted as an external motion, to be voted by the Council and after in referenda queue by the community for the final decision. 

The Council failed to pass the motion, and we suggested to the team to submit this as a public proposal to put it up for vote by the community. The team requested to withdraw their application. This tip aims to return the 500 DOTS deposit for the submission proposal to the team to after reject the treasury proposal and slash the deposit.

items.title: For an instructional video about Nomination pools and staking dashboard to Arabic speaking community
items.content:
![Polkadot](https://i.postimg.cc/B6mJpnsR/Screenshot-2022-11-30-at-12-20-05.png)

Interacting with Polkadot and Kusama can be difficult if it's your first time inside the blockchain. Polkadot.js is a wonderful tool, but we need guides. For this purpose, **Polkadot بالعربي (In Arabic)** produced a detailed breakdown of the Staking System as well as newly implemented Nomination Pools, both accompanied by the new Polkadot Staking Dashboard to further facilitate the easiest way to stake, check validator stats, and manage your nominations: 


- [Selecting a validator and using the new staking dashboard on Polkadot](https://youtu.be/PNcXNVf1Weg)
- [Intro to nomination pools and how to join on the new staking dashboard on Polkadot
](https://youtu.be/OkxL7TCqp7I)

Respectively, as a part of the broader goal of increasing Polkadot awareness and evangelism in the middle east, other educational content on Polkadot, Kusama, and Web3 that have been produced, can also be found on the following links: 


- [What is Polkadot](https://youtu.be/VQKjeFmV5IQ)
- [What is Kusama](https://youtu.be/Oyb4nu1D2Fc)
- [How to create a Polkadot JS wallet](https://youtu.be/-dtIHoOBtF0)
- [What are Parachains on Polkadot & Kusama?](https://youtu.be/znY2J1-EUpg)
- [How to Contribute to Polkadot Crowdloans?](https://youtu.be/Tp9_cYefQqU)
- [What is Web 3.0?](https://youtu.be/ZLBKZjH1tJU)
- [What is Blockchain?](https://youtu.be/XUOL0SPbzpE)

items.title: Guide to Polkadot-JS – Ongoing Maintenance costs for Dec 2021 - Feb 2022
items.content:
This tip is to cover maintenance of the Guide to Polkadot-JS, from Dec 2021 to Feb 2022. A more specific proposal for maintenance can be found on [THIS LINK](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/post/737). 

**Requested DOT**: 102 (Rate: $43.624 USD/DOT which is equivalent to $4,460 USD)

**Short description**: Polkadot-JS was the first wallet developed for the Substrate ecosystem and it is still the go-to wallet today for Relay chains’ and Parachains’ operations. Guide to Polkadot-JS has been providing step-by-step instructions for Polkadot-JS Extension and Apps since early July 2021. This proposal is to request funding for ongoing maintenance tasks for the next 3 months.

Breakdown of costs and user metrics can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yARC5AWL-k2ifL4bZqXZKboq7sMbAa-wKE6mqYtcvoE/edit).

items.title: The ultimate tool for analysing crowdloan candidates
items.content:
Dear Council members,

**Jaze** has created a super google sheets for analyzing the different crowdloan candidates. 

I invite you to take a look at this document [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18Y1jIG4TaRd67D8I-Tg49r8D4tFZk65K/edit#gid=1615362965).

I know at this point you are probably thinking: Didn't we just tip a google sheets? Yes, that was a different one created by Jay. Click [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15mfRFrew6LihDQOH4atMfT9hzj-1goYWBE6LLW-wtKI/edit#gid=749774941) for reference.

Both documents take a very **different** approach at analyzing the projects:

- Jay's document focuses on providing all the information relevant to each project. 

- What makes Jaze's tool stand out is the **price** and **sentiment analysis** and the **rewards calculator**

The price analysis is really well done and provides three potential valuations: low, medium, high. 

Overall it is a very clear analysis of the different projects and the value added here is tremendous. It is the first tool that calculates estimates for expected rewards payout and I think this is what the community was missing up until now. It of course also includes all other relevant info for each of the candidates making it a one stop solution. 

To top it all off, he also made a [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qt6y2n-0Fro&feature=emb_title&ab_channel=JAZE-CryptoInsights) explaining the tool. 

I hope that you can also appreciate the work Jaze has put into this tool.

Thanks for your time.

items.title: Excellent crowd loan project analysis
items.content: Jaze has made a series of videos analysing the different projects competing in the first parachain auction. His videos are extremely insightful and take a deep dive into each projects (each is about 20mins long). They have great supplementary materials to analyse each project factually and objectively. Judging by the number of views on each video, they surely helped many others besides me as well. A video on Acala crowd loan offering: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ehF1e7xrTDU Astar: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XbwNSIMm8IA Litentry: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=\_iKMBz2Em8U Manta: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HNXHwQQ63dA Moonbeam: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-JKzz\_mVIcI Parallel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-oWY7IraIfs SubDAO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bHjeshkPl0U&t=1s Clover: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jh0NCxr9WLg&t=1s Darwinia: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFDhl2kqNnU&t=658s SubGame: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ngDiA7tdPRM&t=274s Crowloan Overview: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GxVd-zqUFgE&t=209s The Creators Dot address can be found in the comment section of the overview video.

items.title: Reward for finding and taking down scam sites as part of the Anti-Scam Community Initiative
items.content:
The Anti-Scam Response Team has come up with an initiative to incentivize community members to find and report to DNS registrars’ scam and phishing sites that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This will be the last month using the tip to reward implementers, starting next month [child-bounty](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/bounty/11) will be utilized.

The process for participating is described in this [Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2iXCCvdkQ70WrfDPtG5uQA3RrCfvb0VDlZjti26q0yb17sg/viewform?usp=sf_link), which is how the participating members submit their reports.

Discord user **pastaMan#9738** has done excellent work since this initiative started and has already received a tip last month for his efforts. This tip is for the sites he found and took down in month of February 2022.

This is a list of these sites:

![Part 1](https://imgur.com/wiRUqSU.jpg)

![Part 2](https://imgur.com/bAOrkaZ.jpg)

![Part 3](https://imgur.com/xSNGTGT.jpg)

All these sites have been reported to the polkadot.js phishing repo as well: [https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing](https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing)

All these sites posed a direct or indirect threat to users and their funds and were damaging the reputation of the ecosystem.

So, we propose to the Council that a total tip of **322.5 DOT** be awarded, which includes the 20% finder’s fee of **64.5 DOT** of the curator that submitted this proposal.

**The curator of this initiative and submitter of this proposal:**

• ccris02: Discord moderator on the Polkadot server, Polkadot Ambassador

attests that he has verified all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules of the initiative.

items.title: reward for various articles
items.content:
This request is for the publication of 4 articles about the common good parachains and 6 articles about XCM. The articles were published in Portuguese by Giorge Abdala, an active member of the DotSama BR community.
The articles were published on the subsocial DotSama, which unites the main content producers in Brazil, and on Giorge's personal Blog Medium.

Here are links to the articles:

**Parachains of common good**

**article 1:**

[https://app.subsocial.network/@dotsamba.dao/as-parachains-de-bem-comum-uma-introducao-aos-slots-de-32587](https://app.subsocial.network/@dotsamba.dao/as-parachains-de-bem-comum-uma-introducao-aos-slots-de-32587)

items.title: Reward for finding and taking down scam sites as part of the Anti-Scam Community Initiative
items.content:
The Anti-Scam Response Team has come up with an initiative to incentivize community members to find and report to DNS registrars’ scam and phishing sites that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This will be the last month using the tip to reward implementers, starting next month [child-bounty](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/bounty/11) will be utilized.

The process for participating is described in this [Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2iXCCvdkQ70WrfDPtG5uQA3RrCfvb0VDlZjti26q0yb17sg/viewform?usp=sf_link), which is how the participating members submit their reports.

Discord user **dubstard#0008** has done excellent work since this initiative started and has already received a tip last month for his efforts. This tip is for the sites he found and took down in month of February 2022.

This is a list of these sites:

![Part 1](https://imgur.com/Uko6LRT.jpg)

All these sites have been reported to the polkadot.js phishing repo as well: [https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing](https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing)

All these sites posed a direct or indirect threat to users and their funds and were damaging the reputation of the ecosystem.

So, we propose to the Council that a total tip of **110 DOT** be awarded, which includes the 20% finder’s fee of **22 DOT** of the curator that submitted this proposal.

**The curator of this initiative and submitter of this proposal:**

• ccris02: Discord moderator on the Polkadot server, Polkadot Ambassador

attests that he has verified all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules of the initiative.

items.title: To Zoe, for an excellent MC job at the Polkadot Foundations stage during Consensus by Coindesk conference in Austin, TX
items.content:
This tip proposal goes out to Zoé Meckbach, Global Head Ambassador of Events for Polkadot, who recently moderated the Polkadot Foundations stage during [Consensus by Coindesk](https://www.coindesk.com/tag/consensus-2022/) conference in Austin, TX on June 11th 2022. 

Overall the Polkadot stage during Consensus was a great success for the whole Polkadot ecosystem. The room was packed with over 200 people and many attendees came up to the speakers after their presentations. It was also a great experience to have Zoé moderating the stage. As a very active member and global head ambassador of Polkadot she gave special insights of the ecosystem and introduced each speaker on a personal note. Such an environment would have not been able to be created with an outside ecosystem moderator. 

**About Foundations stage:**

Foundations is a program within Consensus designed to put the spotlight on thriving blockchain ecosystems. It’s a chance for protocols and projects to design a series of conference sessions specifically aimed at their community: which means developers and other technical contributors as well as the investors, customers and founders. 

Foundations at Consensus was distributed in 2020 with over 20 projects and ecosystems involved. 

**Programme:**

The foundation stage was a programme of 90 minutes and moderated by Zoé. It started with five ecosystem talks, 5 minutes each. A customized intro of each parachain project with ecosystem insights was moderated by Zoé. 

**Ecosystem Spotlight, 30 minutes:**

1. Acala, Dan Reecer, Chief Growth Officer, dan@acala.network , **“Acala’s DeFi platform and the aUSD stablecoin”**

2. Phala Network, Marvin Tong, Co-Founder - **metaverse infra + soulbound NFTs** 

3. Composable Finance, 0xbrainjar, Founder and CEO, **"Composable Finance: The Interoperable Infrastructure for Modular DeFi Functionality”** 

4. Unique Network, Charu Sethi, CMO,  **"A scalable blockchain for composable NFTs with advanced economies"**

4. Rodrigo Gallegos Anda - Product Manager Litentry, **"Tangible identity without being seen!"**

Then three longer sessions were presented with respective intros and professional moderation as well. 

**Changelog, 15 minutes** 

- Polkadot, Robert Habermeier, Founder - represented by Derek Yoo, Founder Moonbeam, **Changelog Q&A, 10 minutes (Q&A period with a gallery of one analyst)** 

- Polkadot, Robert Habermeier, Founder - represented by Derek Yoo, Founder Moonbeam, CoinDesk analyst: Anais Rachel, **Crypto Research Analyst, Bitwise**

**Unlocked, 20 minutes** 

- Moonbeam, Derek Yoo, Founder - **Emerging Trends in Multichain DApp Development Construct 15 minutes** - Kilt, Ingo Rübe, Founder and CEO 

All attendees and community members were highly inspired by Zoé’s work on stage. Please see below posts that report on the community satisfaction.

items.title: Reward for participating in the Anti-Scam Community Initiative for Telegram scam groups (1)
items.content:
The Anti-Scam Response Team came up with an [initiative](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeRgEf5AMxJkmen74A7bZzDc2X5myACfbn8cVfmILvSO7euVg/viewform?usp=sf_link) to incentivize community members to find and report to Telegram scam groups and channels that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This initiative will be sunset, as it was considered ineffective and inefficient and will be redesigned from the ground up as part of the upcoming Anti-Scam Bounty.

As we end this initiative, the Anti-Scam Team wants to recognise the overall efforts of community member @Dannytcan (former @Danny4Dayz), who actively participated in the initiative and did their best to protect the community from Telegram scam groups. 

For this we propose that a tip of 10 DOT is given to them. Their DOT address is:
`12E5bSHLFskJPgPrCoQS5NV81BE2Yt4cmKVvMGk51NGfmP77`

items.title: For creating a website that explains beginners questions in Dotsama ecosystem
items.content:
Hello Council Members, 


Being in the Dotsama ecosystem for three years, I have catered to multiple perspectives of operating or understanding the dot ecosystem. One of the common issues that I have consistently seen our users face, is a lack of a common platform for addressing their concerns from time to time. This includes hopping from platforms like discord to element and seeking answers from moderators. This creates a redundant flow of information because moderators might have to answer the same questions nth times.

Realising this a problem, I did in-depth research and created a platform named [newtodot](http://newtodot.xyz/) a list of 200 Frequently Asked Questions(FAQs). This will help the moderators to directly use this platform’s link as a reference.

I will be adding more questions frequently for the new users in the upcoming days. I will be really thankful if the council members can support this initiative.

items.title: For a podcast episode on Web3 Tech, blockchain tech and Polkadot: with guest Kirill Pimenov (Parity Tech)
items.content:
**Podlodka** is a weekly audio show about IT and everything that interests the community.

Each episode is a full immersion into the topic with a guest speaker. They talk about development, share industry development experiences and discuss hot topics. On the one hand they like to deep-dive into complex technologies. For example, they talked about distributed computing, networks, compilers, or cryptocurrencies. Some other times, their interests do not stop in technical topics: that’s why they have recorded episodes about sleep, meditation, and parenthood.

On this particular episode (focus of this tip) the hosts invited Kirill Pimenov (Head of Security @ Parity Tech): In the first part of the podcast, they discussed the technical components of blockchains with a focus on Polkadot: how cryptocurrencies are connected to blockchain networks and the reason why anonymity is achieved, how to avoid double spending among other general problems solved by the tech. In the second part, the hosts discussed the social aspect of blockchain: a tool that allows people to unite in potentially infinite communities not because of external coercion or fear, but for their own benefit.

In the past five years, They have  released more than 250 episodes. On average, each one is listened to around 15,000-20,000 times, and in total they have over 5 million listens. They mainly host the podcast on Soundcloud: [https://soundcloud.com/podlodka](https://soundcloud.com/podlodka). Their audience is mostly represented by backend, iOS, android developers and team leaders. More than 50% of the audience identified themselves as senior developers according to a recent survey.

Links to the episode: 

- Soundcloud: [here](https://soundcloud.com/podlodka/podlodka-ep-260)
- Google Podcast: [here](https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cHM6Ly9mZWVkcy5zb3VuZGNsb3VkLmNvbS91c2Vycy9zb3VuZGNsb3VkOnVzZXJzOjI5MTMzNzEwNi9zb3VuZHMucnNz/episode/dGFnOnNvdW5kY2xvdWQsMjAxMDp0cmFja3MvMTIzNjIwMTY0MA)
- Apple Podcast: [here](https://podcasts.apple.com/ru/podcast/podlodka-260-%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%BF%D1%82%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BB%D1%8E%D1%82%D1%8B/id1209828744?i=1000554742622)
- Youtube channel: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=prHziwNhOMQ)

In all descriptions you can find the DOT address to verify the beneficiary.

items.title: For an article about stake news on Polkadot and Kusama (CryptoLab Project) https://polkadot.com.br/artigos/a-revolucao-do-stake
items.content:
This is a tip whose proposer address (14uWCEwGQQ5qC24pkq5vbxsXtgS3Md2BAYJBvSstDy3XiU34) is shown in on-chain info below.

> Address Verification is in the end of Article. 13B5zGLfXBhRpiQ1xcnsNeqbHHcRRRpBCL41xCJxdYmYoHdW

ecardo5o is an active member of the brazilian DotSama community. He has published the website Polkadot.com.br to concentrate content produced by the brazilian community in the format of reports and articles. He also helped to structure on Youtube the channels [Polkadot Brasil](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrvymwHco28Se03JTw8Z9A) and [PolkaCortes Brasil](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4zTcPUdTdNcpnTwfEN4KWw) (with the Ambassador Lui5). This request is for the Article below (A Revolução do Stake - about stake news on Polkadot and Kusama - CryptoLab Project) and that's why I recommend this TIP.

**A Revolução do Stake**
[https://polkadot.com.br/artigos/a-revolucao-do-stake](https://polkadot.com.br/artigos/a-revolucao-do-stake)

**The Stake Revolution**

Interest in Stake has been widespread among non-technical users for some time. At the same time, there has not yet been a significant evolution in the interfaces that manage these portfolios to provide an easier way of understanding and use. This situation has been the subject of debates and solutions in the DotSama ecosystem, which was designed to prioritize decentralization above all.

![](https://i.ibb.co/qjxGg5s/Captura-de-Tela-2022-04-10-a-s-21-40-07.png)

The Problem

The consensus method used to delegate a validator (NPoS) allows the Nominator user to choose up to 24 Validators. If, on the one hand, there is greater freedom of indications, on the other hand, there is the problem of how to manage so many options.

![](https://i.ibb.co/zbSwq1P/Captura-de-Tela-2022-04-10-a-s-21-41-51.png)

The CryptoLab Solution

To resolve this impasse, the CryptoLab project was created, which received funds from the Kusama Treasury to carry out its Phase 1, which is already operational. The next planned phases are already being sent to raise funds at the Polkadot Treasury.

This separation is due to the characteristics of the project, which is being implemented to serve both networks. Even in its initial phase, CryptoLab already offers this option. Which is great news for everyone.

According to its makers, “Our goal is to make staking comprehensive for people who are not yet familiar with Blockchain, from basic writing to data representation. And for that, we are bringing these interfaces closer to what would be closer to an investment portfolio, where there are different strategies involving risk and return”.

As a complement, the project also had the support of the Web3 Foundation for the construction of a Stake Reward Collector that helped in the redesign of the tools below (scheduled for Phase 3 of the project but already delivered). Check it out here at [CryptoLab Tools](https://tools.cryptolab.network/).

items.title: To Helikon (Kutsal) for ChainSynth (alpha.chainsynth.app)
items.content:
ChainSynth ([alpha.chainsynth.app](alpha.chainsynth.app)) is the first step in the creation of a generative audio-visual synthesizer working with real-time blockchain data on Polkadot. It updates the generated audio at every finalized block as explained below.

- Modulo of the block hash determines the root note and the scale, from the following set: C Lydian, F Major, D Major, G Major, A Major, G Whole-Tone.
- Number of events in the block defines the speed of the succession of the melody notes.
- Number of extrinsics defines the depth of reverb applied to the melody.

More info, including verification of the address if needed, can be found [here](https://github.com/helikon-labs/chainsynth/blob/main/README.md).

items.title: 7 defi how-to videos and bridging
To DU Web3 Club: for organisizing an ideathon / hackathon to incentivize students to learn about Web3/blockchain/Polkadot
items.content:
To verify Identity, check Twitter bio: [https://twitter.com/du_web3](https://twitter.com/du_web3)

The DU Web3 Club aims to grow awareness around the technologies at DU university. The team hosted an ideathon / hackathon / competition (with prize payouts) to incentivize students to come learn about this tech stack. This competition was focused on how DAOs can benefit universities and Polkadot was a part of it!
 
**Web3 Club @ University of Denver**
Jeremy Osborne, Club President, Computer Science Student
Matthew Romo-NIchols, Club Vice-President, Business Student
Thaddeus “Peter” White, Club Tech Officer, Computer Science Student

Dan Shields, at Parity, helped to plan the event, **hosted a Polkadot introductory workshop**, and participated as a judge to review the student’s ideas. 

The University of Denver is lacking awareness around web3 technologies. The club also noticed that Polkadot as an ecosystem is trying to grow awareness at the university level and decided to include Polkadot in the event. In order to incentivize students to participate, they paid out and marketed prizes to them. Currently, they are $1,500 short of our set prize goal.

The team brought exposure to Polkadot ecosystem during this competition at the University of Denver, including sessions with students on the Polkadot ecosystem and I believe this should be encouraged and rewarded: especially when the club is in need to cover the completion of prizes for the event. 

At the event, Polkadot participated in the following ways:

- An introductory workshop to Polkadot and Substrate hosted by Dan Shields
- Encourage students to use Polkadot in their DAO ideas
- Place Polkadot’s logo in a location for event attendees to see 

The Polkadot workshop hosted by Dan Shields helped the club create a better event for all attendees. The students participating in the competition were educated on the Polkadot ecosystem and how their DAO idea could utilize Polkadot. 

- Dan Shields Polkadot Workshop. 16 attendees. Attendees were from the University of Denver (DU), as well as attendees from the Denver, Colorado: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BQQsObPEQyXG52RbP5mL50CZlfvU3vkM/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BQQsObPEQyXG52RbP5mL50CZlfvU3vkM/view?usp=sharing)

- Kickoff sponsor shoutout. A couple attendees via zoom, and about 15 attendees in-person (mostly DU students). Other attendees included an ETHDenver hackathon finalist, ETHDenver steward, Cryptorado members, and one of the leaders of ShapeShift DAO: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/11k7kCxmdL2p2ZUlBlFLtAGbqIFFsCIDN/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11k7kCxmdL2p2ZUlBlFLtAGbqIFFsCIDN/view?usp=sharing)

- Student presentation incorporating the Polkadot ecosystem into their DAO Idea. About 25 attendees received explanation of how Polkadot will benefit their idea. This presentation is recorded: 

a. [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Tkul_FME73vpejBuGmF-da9qCAUcUNsG/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Tkul_FME73vpejBuGmF-da9qCAUcUNsG/view?usp=sharing)

b. [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DnGisMt3MfLJjeR65w5Xv3s-ybXvpj2m/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DnGisMt3MfLJjeR65w5Xv3s-ybXvpj2m/view?usp=sharing)

items.title: Polkadot-Porfolio MVP
items.content:
I (@kianenigma) write the original `polkadot-portfolio` as a CLI app earlier this year. The objective was simple: read-only, in detail portfolio app for the entire Polkadot ecosystem, relying only on onchain data (and soon light clients). 

A few months ago, I asked an old friend/former-colleague of mine Hosein (13HCnHKxS26NreRYiH5LCeyTQzQvXDCcS9hC5G6nhnSj1KFS - https://github.com/HoseinEmrani) to write a UI for it. This is still ongoing, but we've reached a point where there is a MVP  that can be used. I am opening this tip to express my support for Hosein's work and plan to continue opening tips every now and then once we reach a major milestone.

The project as a while is more of PoC and I don't see it being used in an enterprise manner, because of its onchain-data-only nature. Nonetheless, if parachain teams help us with implementing custom logic related to their chain, it can someday become a good minimal alternative to other Portfolio apps out there (e.g. sub.id and talisman).

items.title: To aid a community member who lost 10.18 DOT by mistakenly sending funds directly to a nomination pool rewards address
items.content:
Dear council,

I have opened a tip for a community member who mistakenly sent [10.18 DOT directly to nomination pool 61](https://polkadot.subscan.io/extrinsic/13355740-2) instead of using the nominationPools.join extrinsic. By this action and given that no one holds the private key for the destination account, the user is now unable to access funds. Considering that the balances.forceTransfer call is very powerful and it takes a more complex process, and the balance is low, I think the best option is to refund this community member through a tip. If you know any other solution, we are open to listen to you.

You can find the references below:

[Rewards address of the pool 61](https://polkadot.subscan.io/account/13UVJyLnbVp8c4FQeiGYEwEKvJcqfvpmypp2gHHP8nxqnpGJ)

[Transaction to the pool rewards address](https://polkadot.subscan.io/extrinsic/13355740-2)

A similar event happened in the past and is being taken as a reference. You can see it [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/tip/0x410a4f0a577cac54e6f5fec623f7c07602b0e9668375bd8c8c1922de79952692).

items.title: Twitter Spaces Sessions about Polkadot for Hispanic community.
items.content:
This is a session of twitter space with a great ally to Polkadot and Kusama, Mad Cripto, he is the most influential Spanish-speaking communicator in the region.
[Twitter Spaces Sessions](https://twitter.com/pepearaucano/status/1611124788595933186?s=20)

[Repost by Bein Crypto](https://twitter.com/beincrypto_es/header_photo)
The space was developed at the beginning of the Polkadot Blockchain Academy, how anecdote was moderated within the academy and had a certain impact in its publication of 32.5K and with a large call for listeners.

Maarmapa (Head Ambassador) was also a guest and participated, among others, Jaume, who was the person who starred in the involuntary incident with Acala explaining the reasons.

The important thing about the realization of these twitter spaces by ambassadors and referents of the ecosystem is because it gives the members of the community the opportunity to have a direct approach with them, ask questions and have the opportunity to be direct participants.
This is Pepe host 20th Twitter Spaces session, and the first tip request.

Other random sessions and impact:

[Twitter spaces with RMRK and BitCountry members](https://twitter.com/pepearaucano/status/1504108716077072384)

[Twitter Space with Parity Member](https://twitter.com/pepearaucano/status/1511346810517864464)

[Twitter space with Astar members](https://twitter.com/AstarNetwork_ES/status/1494811746757922819)

[Twitter space with Kilt and Phala members](https://twitter.com/pepearaucano/status/1519054239498051584)






ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Pepe.Dot - Polkadot and Kusama ambassador
[pepearaucano](https://twitter.com/pepearaucano)

Pepe is communicator, publicist, team builder and engaged contributor to Dotsama community, creator of the Polkadot and Kusama community on Twitter, moderator and creator of the Polkadot Argentina team (https://t.me/polkadotARUR) group on Telegram and Twitter [(Polkadot](https://twitter.com/PolkadotArgenta) Argentina TW) and Polkadot Uruguay.
Through multiple Twitter feeds, he was able to interview and twitter spaces Web3 creators from the multi-parachain community focused on NFTs, Metaverses and community.

Many of the known memes in the ecosystem have come out of his factory, which he believes is new-age marketing.

[1st prize for Polkadot adforchads](https://twitter.com/Polkadot/status/1473239279606325255)

[3st prize Polkadot adforchads](https://twitter.com/pepearaucano/status/1470732163976876032)

He is the organizer and part of the Polkadot Decoded Buenos Aires 2022 proposal with the Polka Haus team.

Also simultaneously carried out the side event for Kusama Network (https://twitter.com/kaosinba) 

Due to its dynamics, effort and commitment to communication and the community, it has made solid links with many main players in the Dotsama industry.

I also work for the venture studio Supercolony and in the organization of the WasmConf https://wasm-conference.com/

And all that remains is to present a series of antecedents of the work carried out in this long journey.
Some of we went through the events
He has also worked tirelessly in the realization of POLKADOT DECODED BA 2022, from the beginning he joined the organization initially proposed by Parity Technologies, providing advice on logistics, Latin American culture and various consultancies, finally joining the official proposal which was approved by POLKA HAUS being part of the central organization of the largest event organized to date in this region.
https://docs.google.com/document/d/19fS61iKtIPcZu5-rmb8AoduWL3QG4fSL5mfH6no-cuU/edit#

And he is also the architect of the first Kusama Network side event [KAOS IN BA](https://twitter.com/kaosinba/status/1543964313831911424) for the Spanish-speaking community that was run through the treasury, and took place on July 1, 2022, having an overwhelming success, surpassing the promise of expected applications, so the work team for the new editions has doubled.

One more part of this trip is the creation of 2 groups to unite the Argentine and Uruguay community and organize future meetings, stay in touch and spread any type of official information about the ecosystem.

He created the Polkadot & Kusama community on Twitter.
Another global communication channel between some industry players that you can find as moderators in the group.
POLKADOT AND KUSAMA Community

He participated in the first edition of the Polkadot Hackathon Latam obtaining a second place in smart contracts with his recent project DOTOCRACY.

2023

This year he was summoned again to participate in the Polkadot Blockchain Academy edition number 2 in Buenos Aires on a voluntary basis. And he traveled from Italy for it.

He also carried out parallel activities in conjunction with the Adlib! production organized by the PBA.
He was a collaborator and in charge of summoning the community at Academy Open Night, 3 parallel events held at the university.
He also hosted PolkaSunset a side event for graduate students, the Parity team and the Argentine community in Buenos Aires.

Lastly, he was the creator of the community [Polkadot Uruguay](https://twitter.com/PolkadotUruguay)
and he held the first [meetUp](https://twitter.com/PolkadotUruguay/status/1629588216670986242) in the capital of that country, Montevideo with the graduates of PBA and community.

items.title: Tip to Ryabina for add-ons on Ryabina Bot
items.content: The Ryabina team added a new set of notifications on their bot to notify all stakeholders on Kusama and Polkadot about runtime upgrades and emergency situations via remark. The call is triggered by the Parity team from a multisig wallet whenever a runtime upgrade is voted. Each time a message is ready to be sent, one of the accounts triggers a msg using system.remark that the bot will pick up to issue a message to those subscribing to the service. This messaging system complements newsletter emails notifying stakeholders of the changes, an essential part of the forkless upgrade processes in the ecosystem. Link to msg image: https://imgur.com/a/rCNe8lX

items.title: Our team translated Polkadot's core papers into Chinese
items.content:
Dear council/treasury

My name is Guo Bin, Polkadot ambassador for China, from the State Grid Research Institute. Three months ago, several Polkadot ambassadors and I established a translation team, hoping to bring Polkadot's core design content to the Polkadot ecology in China. We believe that providing in-depth and valuable content can inspire more talented developers and researchers to participate in the ecology.

Now, we have completed the release of the [first version](https://github.com/AmadeusGB/Overview-of-Polkadot) for everyone, and continue to receive feedback from all parties to improve it.For further promotion and publicity, we have written articles to promote it on [WeChat platform](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/bcDsxMuQmTZIi1qSpWOMOg)/Substrate development technology group


In the future, we intend to write some analysis articles for Substrate data structure/BABE consensus algorithm.

items.title: Reward for finding and reporting Telegram scam groups as part of the Anti-Scam Community Initiative (2)
items.content:
The Anti-Scam Response Team has come up with an initiative to incentivize community members to find and report to Telegram scam groups and channels that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This initiative aims to make use of the sub-bounties pallet once it’s part of the runtime to issue rewards, but in the meantime it is being tested out with a small number of participants and the rewards are issued with tips. This tip proposal is for such a reward.

This process has been revamped since this testing phase began and it’s described in detail in this Google form - that is now the sole method of participating in the initiative.

However, the process has changed since it was first implemented and the most notable changes are:

A user could get a reward of 1 DOT for simply finding a scam group. Reporting it to Telegram was a separate action with a separate reward.
The reward for reporting it to Telegram was 5 DOT split among all users who reported it before the group/channel was flagged as scam. This has now changed to 1 DOT per report.
The reporting process has been significantly revamped to make identification of reported sites much easier.

Telegram user **@Danny4dayz (12E5bSHLFskJPgPrCoQS5NV81BE2Yt4cmKVvMGk51NGfmP77)** has been doing excellent work since this initiative started. He has found and reported several groups resulting in many of them or their admins receiving the “scam” flag by Telegram, as well as participating actively in the initiative and providing feedback.

However, the process of tracking which groups had been found by which user and which ones were reported to Telegram was not very well structured in the first phase of the initiative. As a result, it’s not easy to know which groups precisely have been flagged by Telegram or which users contributed to that.

For this reason we propose that the user receives a tip of 15 DOT for the sum of their efforts, also taking into consideration the 5 DOT reward per flagging that applied until now. 

**The curators of this initiative:**

**@JackEsky:** Active member of the community and admin of the official Polkadot Telegram channel. He’s been actively fighting Telegram scams for several months.

**@michalisFr:** Web3 Foundation employee and member of the Anti-Scam Report Team who leads this initiative 

Both attest that they have verified as best they could all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules that applied at each time and support this proposal with the associated amount.

items.title: for translation of the Messari article
items.content:
This request is for the Portuguese translation of the latest Messari Hub article on Polkadot.
The article was translated by Giorge Abdala and was originally posted on the Brazilian blog PolkaMix. After the good repercussion, Mercurius crypto (a large Brazilian research house) reposted the article on its institutional blog.
The translated article was also shown in a live held by the same research house.

link to Original Messari article: [https://messari.io/article/polkadot-ecosystem-overview](https://messari.io/article/polkadot-ecosystem-overview)

link to the original translation:[ https://medium.com/@giorgeabdala/vis%C3%A3o-geral-do-ecossistema-polkadot-um-mergulho-nas-11-parachains-91cda80ffbde](https://medium.com/@giorgeabdala/vis%C3%A3o-geral-do-ecossistema-polkadot-um-mergulho-nas-11-parachains-91cda80ffbde)

link to article repost on Mercurius crypto: [https://mercurius-academy.mn.co/posts/visao-geral-do-ecossistema-polkadot-um-mergulho-nas-11-parachains
](https://mercurius-academy.mn.co/posts/visao-geral-do-ecossistema-polkadot-um-mergulho-nas-11-parachains
)

link to the Mercurius live where the article is shown (
**00:04:47 minutes and 00:43:00 minutes**) : [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uCIVhIDccPI](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uCIVhIDccPI)


The article was highly praised in the Brazilian community.

items.title: Reward for finding and taking down scam sites as part of the Anti-Scam Community Initiative
items.content:
The Anti-Scam Response Team has come up with an initiative to incentivize community members to find and report to DNS registrars’ scam and phishing sites that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This initiative aims to make use of the sub-bounties pallet once it’s part of the runtime to issue rewards, but in the meantime, it is being tested out with a small number of participants and the rewards are issued with tips. This tip proposal is for such a reward.

The process for participating is described in this [Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2iXCCvdkQ70WrfDPtG5uQA3RrCfvb0VDlZjti26q0yb17sg/viewform?usp=sf_link), which is how the participating members submit their reports.

Discord user **frankywild#8573** has done excellent work since this initiative started and has already received a tip last month for his efforts. This tip is for the sites he found and took down in November.

This is a list of these sites:

![Part 1](https://i.imgur.com/oYuVhza.jpg)

![Part 2](https://i.imgur.com/BhLHGxz.jpg)


All these sites have been reported to the polkadot.js phishing repo as well: [https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing](https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing)

All these sites posed a direct or indirect threat to users and their funds and were damaging the reputation of the ecosystem.

So, we propose to the Council that a total tip of **208.75 DOT** be awarded, which includes the 20% finder’s fee of **41.75 DOT** of the curator that submitted this proposal.

**The curator of this initiative and submitter of this proposal:**

• ccris02: Discord moderator on the Polkadot server, Polkadot Ambassador

attests that he has verified all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules of the initiative.

items.title: Multiple contributions to Polkadot Wiki
items.content:
Polkadot wiki is the central source of truth for the Polkadot ecosystem. Thus it's important it has good UX and remains bug-free.
My contributions towards this goal: 
1. I pointed out an important UX issue on the "Thousand validators programme" page of the wiki. That page was missing the contents sidebar. The buttons at the end of the page which help to navigate to the next/previous article were also missing. These missing components lead to a bad UX and break the flow of reading for users.
    * Issue on github:  [#2502](https://github.com/w3f/polkadot-wiki/issues/2502)
2. Fixed multiple links to the research paper titled `Network Time with a Consensus on Clock`. The fix was applied across multiple pages including all translated docs.
    * PR on github: [#2503](https://github.com/w3f/polkadot-wiki/pull/2503)
3. Fixed two minor typos. PR on github: [#2471](https://github.com/w3f/polkadot-wiki/pull/2471)

items.title: Tip to Sebastian in recognition of community support and education to the Polkadot Spanish community
items.content:
Sebastian (@SebastianCrypto in some social networks, including TG) has for more than 11 months been dedicating his time to Polkadot research and helping the Spanish community.

He has invested most of his time educating and helping the Spanish Polkadot community. The Spanish community is quite large, with more than 5700 members and a very large daily activity. This channel respects most of the W3F rules of conduct.

Group: [https://t.me/polkadotespanol](https://t.me/polkadotespanol)

Sebastian also translated educational reading materials about Polkadot & Kusama. He created the space ["Polkadot Español" in Subsocial](https://app.subsocial.network/@PolkadotEspanol) in May 2021 to use this space to publish all articles/educational posts about Polkadot & Kusama. Currently the channel has more than 100 publications (all educational articles) and serves as a source of information.

Space: [https://app.subsocial.network/@PolkadotEspanol](https://app.subsocial.network/@PolkadotEspanol)

Sebastian has answered more than 7,500 messages in the Polkadot Spanish group from people requesting information. Sebastian also supports the Kusama Spanish community (TG group): This group has 1,300 members and where he has answered more than 4000 msgs.

In June 2021 he created the [Polkadot & Kusama "announcements" channel](https://t.me/PolkadotNoticias) in Spanish. This was initially created to share Bill Laboon's daily digests in Spanish but later became a reading channel to learn about Polkadot, Kusama and Substrate. This channel is used to share all articles translated to Spanish that are in Subsocial, with a brief description so that the user clicks on it if interested. The channel is also used to share the latest news/announcements: updates to Statemint (what is Statemint), referenda up for vote, democracy changes, etc. he also uses this channel to encourage participation in governance. The channel has 242 publications. All can be seen and will be detailed in the document.

Channel: [https://t.me/PolkadotNoticias](https://t.me/PolkadotNoticias)

Full document (links with translations): https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ueHEeh4Ong53aRWU2p4phMoc4Y-1ouVAgjj_ldpzZH4/edit

Element user: @sebastiancrypto:matrix.org

items.title: For an article about Substrate https://polkadot.com.br/artigos/do-substrato-ao-multiverso
items.content:
This is a tip whose proposer address (14uWCEwGQQ5qC24pkq5vbxsXtgS3Md2BAYJBvSstDy3XiU34) is shown in on-chain info below.

> Address Verification is in the end of Article. 13B5zGLfXBhRpiQ1xcnsNeqbHHcRRRpBCL41xCJxdYmYoHdW

ecardo5o is an active member of the brazilian DotSama community. He has published the website Polkadot.com.br to concentrate content produced by the brazilian community in the format of reports and articles. He also helped to structure on Youtube the channels [Polkadot Brasil](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrvymwHco28Se03JTw8Z9A) and [PolkaCortes Brasil](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4zTcPUdTdNcpnTwfEN4KWw) (with the Ambassador Lui5).


### This request is for the Article below (Do Substrato ao Multiverso - an article about Substrate) and that's why I recommend this TIP.


**Do Substrato ao Multiverso**
[https://polkadot.com.br/artigos/do-substrato-ao-multiverso](https://polkadot.com.br/artigos/do-substrato-ao-multiverso)

**From Substrate to Multiverse**

There are indeed many ways to establish fundamentalist criteria for analysis on the DotSama ecosystem. But perhaps the most important of all goes completely unnoticed by most DOTs and KSMs holders. And it's called [Substrate](https://substrate.io/). But what is this invisible entity that is part of every high-level conversation in the DotSama multiverse?

What is Substrate?

Substrate is a development framework that allows maximizing the efforts of different teams that today are spread all over the world. With it, you can build a blockchain from scratch and launch it in hours.

Without a tool like Substrate, it would be impossible to deal with all the complexity of the DotSama ecosystem and make it move forward at the current speed.

![](https://i.ibb.co/51MFfny/Captura-de-Tela-2022-04-10-a-s-22-09-01.png)

But How All This Happens?

In fact it is not something magical or mysterious. But pure systems architecture. Substrate was designed to be a huge library of open source, customizable components that connect to each other to meet complex needs, called [Pallets](https://substrate.io/technology/flexible/).

Each of them is dedicated to a specific function of the network. And as the ecosystem itself becomes more complex, more Pallets will be generated forming a gigantic digital lego.

If there is a secret weapon in the DotSama ecosystem, here it is. But its purposes are far from the warmongering metaphor. And the impact it generates goes far beyond technology.

![](https://i.ibb.co/4W28XPP/Captura-de-Tela-2022-04-10-a-s-22-09-44.png)

Many is better than one

Substrate was born from looking at multiplicity. That only a network with a general purpose would not really be able to deal with all the things that exist in the real plane but that we really need to achieve them as the purpose of Web3.

And that we must go further, shaping the world around us in light of all the technology and shared knowledge that we have access to. And that's the gist of it all.

items.title: Tip to Ryabina for add-ons on Ryabina Bot
items.content: The Ryabina team added a new set of notifications on their bot to notify all stakeholders on Kusama and Polkadot about runtime upgrades and emergency situations via remark. The call is triggered by the Parity team from a multisig wallet whenever a runtime upgrade is voted. Each time a message is ready to be sent, one of the accounts triggers a msg using system.remark that the bot will pick up to issue a message to those subscribing to the service. This messaging system complements newsletter emails notifying stakeholders of the changes, an essential part of the forkless upgrade processes in the ecosystem. Link to msg image: https://imgur.com/a/rCNe8lX

items.title: Our team translated Polkadot's core papers into Chinese
items.content:
Dear council/treasury

My name is Guo Bin, Polkadot ambassador for China, from the State Grid Research Institute. Three months ago, several Polkadot ambassadors and I established a translation team, hoping to bring Polkadot's core design content to the Polkadot ecology in China. We believe that providing in-depth and valuable content can inspire more talented developers and researchers to participate in the ecology.

Now, we have completed the release of the [first version](https://github.com/AmadeusGB/Overview-of-Polkadot) for everyone, and continue to receive feedback from all parties to improve it.For further promotion and publicity, we have written articles to promote it on [WeChat platform](https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/bcDsxMuQmTZIi1qSpWOMOg)/Substrate development technology group


In the future, we intend to write some analysis articles for Substrate data structure/BABE consensus algorithm.

items.title: Reward for finding and reporting Telegram scam groups as part of the Anti-Scam Community Initiative (2)
items.content:
The Anti-Scam Response Team has come up with an initiative to incentivize community members to find and report to Telegram scam groups and channels that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This initiative aims to make use of the sub-bounties pallet once it’s part of the runtime to issue rewards, but in the meantime it is being tested out with a small number of participants and the rewards are issued with tips. This tip proposal is for such a reward.

This process has been revamped since this testing phase began and it’s described in detail in this Google form - that is now the sole method of participating in the initiative.

However, the process has changed since it was first implemented and the most notable changes are:

A user could get a reward of 1 DOT for simply finding a scam group. Reporting it to Telegram was a separate action with a separate reward.
The reward for reporting it to Telegram was 5 DOT split among all users who reported it before the group/channel was flagged as scam. This has now changed to 1 DOT per report.
The reporting process has been significantly revamped to make identification of reported sites much easier.

Telegram user **@Danny4dayz (12E5bSHLFskJPgPrCoQS5NV81BE2Yt4cmKVvMGk51NGfmP77)** has been doing excellent work since this initiative started. He has found and reported several groups resulting in many of them or their admins receiving the “scam” flag by Telegram, as well as participating actively in the initiative and providing feedback.

However, the process of tracking which groups had been found by which user and which ones were reported to Telegram was not very well structured in the first phase of the initiative. As a result, it’s not easy to know which groups precisely have been flagged by Telegram or which users contributed to that.

For this reason we propose that the user receives a tip of 15 DOT for the sum of their efforts, also taking into consideration the 5 DOT reward per flagging that applied until now. 

**The curators of this initiative:**

**@JackEsky:** Active member of the community and admin of the official Polkadot Telegram channel. He’s been actively fighting Telegram scams for several months.

**@michalisFr:** Web3 Foundation employee and member of the Anti-Scam Report Team who leads this initiative 

Both attest that they have verified as best they could all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules that applied at each time and support this proposal with the associated amount.

However, the process has changed since it was first implemented and the most notable changes are:

A user could get a reward of 1 DOT for simply finding a scam group. Reporting it to Telegram was a separate action with a separate reward.
The reward for reporting it to Telegram was 5 DOT split among all users who reported it before the group/channel was flagged as scam. This has now changed to 1 DOT per report.
The reporting process has been significantly revamped to make identification of reported sites much easier.

Telegram user **@Suguangrui (15cgCPCLyyaNV2PuE9uEciQoWzvQVC3PxCJRfn3CtqFkzpRa)** has been doing excellent work since this initiative started. He has found and reported several groups resulting in many of them or their admins receiving the “scam” flag by Telegram, as well as participating actively in the initiative and providing feedback.

However, the process of tracking which groups had been found by which user and which ones were reported to Telegram was not very well structured in the first phase of the initiative. As a result, it’s not easy to know which groups precisely have been flagged by Telegram or which users contributed to that.

For this reason we propose that the user receives a tip of 15 DOT for the sum of their efforts, also taking into consideration the 5 DOT reward per flagging that applied until now. 

**The curators of this initiative:**

**@JackEsky:** Active member of the community and admin of the official Polkadot Telegram channel. He’s been actively fighting Telegram scams for several months.

**@michalisFr:** Web3 Foundation employee and member of the Anti-Scam Report Team who leads this initiative 

Both attest that they have verified as best they could all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules that applied at each time and support this proposal with the associated amount.

items.title: Reward for finding and taking down scam sites as part of the Anti-Scam Community Initiative
items.content:
The Anti-Scam Response Team has come up with an initiative to incentivize community members to find and report to DNS registrars’ scam and phishing sites that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This initiative aims to make use of the sub-bounties pallet once it’s part of the runtime to issue rewards, but in the meantime, it is being tested out with a small number of participants and the rewards are issued with tips. This tip proposal is for such a reward.

The process for participating is described in this [Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2iXCCvdkQ70WrfDPtG5uQA3RrCfvb0VDlZjti26q0yb17sg/viewform?usp=sf_link), which is how the participating members submit their reports.

Discord user **frankywild#8573** has done excellent work since this initiative started and has already received a tip last month for his efforts. This tip is for the sites he found and took down in November.

This is a list of these sites:

![Part 1](https://i.imgur.com/oYuVhza.jpg)

![Part 2](https://i.imgur.com/BhLHGxz.jpg)


All these sites have been reported to the polkadot.js phishing repo as well: [https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing](https://github.com/polkadot-js/phishing)

All these sites posed a direct or indirect threat to users and their funds and were damaging the reputation of the ecosystem.

So, we propose to the Council that a total tip of **208.75 DOT** be awarded, which includes the 20% finder’s fee of **41.75 DOT** of the curator that submitted this proposal.

**The curator of this initiative and submitter of this proposal:**

• ccris02: Discord moderator on the Polkadot server, Polkadot Ambassador

attests that he has verified all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules of the initiative.

items.title: to Kelvin Welter for polkahistory.com - a snapshot balance tool to help filing income taxes.
items.content: Kelvin is an active member of the Portuguese community. After one of our members asked for a tool to easily query DOT balances on a given day (for tax purposes), he decided to build one. He came up with PolkaHistory, a straight-forward tool to search of your balance on any given day and time. In Brazil, we have to declare the amount of tokens we had in the last day of the last year, this tool makes it very simple. He also did a version for Kusama at https://www.polkahistory.com/kusama. If you click on the top right corner icon you can switch from Polkadot to Kusama and vice-versa. The application changes from dark mode to white mode when switching networks, pretty cool detail. I'm also opening a tip on Kusama as I think he deserves both. You can verify Kelvin's address on the right side of the page's footer.

items.title: XCM and bridges on Polkadot and Kusama.
items.content:
Hi, I'm Guillitolmo and I create content about crypto and Dotsama on [my Twitter](https://twitter.com/guillitolmo) and [my Youtube channel](https://www.youtube.com/c/Guillitolmo/videos). For Youtube [I made this live video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JEcbD1SlY_c) about XCM and bridges on Polkadot and Kusama.

I talked about the following topics in these minutes:

2:52-3:43. Relay Chain.

3:50-9:30. XCM

11:43-17:28 I show examples of assets with XCM in Kusama (Metamask and Karura) and how UPM is not yet implemented in Polkadot (Acala).

17:35-24:00. VMP (UPM and DMP), XCMP and HRMP.

24:05-30:25. Bridge information and brief comparison vs XCM.

30:30-34:10. Other news of interest related to XCM.

I have written [this article](https://app.subsocial.network/5536/xcm-en-polkadot-y-kusama-guillitolmo-32594) on Subsocial so that board members who do not speak Spanish can read it in English (as long as they translate it). In the article I mention the same as in the live one I have done.

Thank you for your tips. They will be greatly appreciated to continue creating valuable content for the community.

items.title: Translation of Substrate series documents into Chinese And polkapie.org
items.content:
It is quite difficult for many developers to understand non-native language documents，and in fact majority of the developers will choose the documents in native language in under the circumstances that there are accurate documents in native language. Because the documents in Polkadot and Substrate are still not comprehensive，ZeroDAO plans to translate all documents in Polka into Chinese.And so far we have translated 141 article，including recipes，knowledgebase，all courses，ink! Smart contracts and also all comment of the codes，among which 76 articles have been complete translated. And we also have proofread and localized all documents and we finally integrated them into a community of enthusiasts: [https://polkapie.org](https://polkapie.org)

validation : https://polkapie.org/validation.txt

### We have done the following

**1.translation**

We have translated all the recipes, some tutorials, some knowledgebases, and ink! in the official documents into Chinese, including all necessary comments. In total, 76 documents are completely translated.

**2. proofread and localization**

Proofreading and localization of translated documents, including existing translations in crowdin. Also standardize the terminology related to blockchain, distributed systems, P2P, Rust, and Substrate itself.

**3.extended documents**

Optimizations for specific environments, such as setup for Windows and source replacement for rustup and cargo, extend the official documents in order to optimize the developer experience for Rust beginners and Windows environments.

### Next step

**1. improve translation and products**

At present there are still problems with the Chinese documentation, which needs to be continuously optimized.

**2. establish translation standards，and introduce cooperation**

During the translation of the documents，we found the importance of consistent terminology. The development of Substrate involves many fields and establishing the translation standards including terminology standards and form standards is full of great importance of cooperative translation. Then we will introduce cooperative translation.

**3. update official documents**

After establishing stable version，we will use crowdin or github to update related documents of the ecosystem.

**4. translate other documents**

We will try to translate other documents in the ecosystem，including Api，polkadot.js and so on.

**5. Establish hobbyist community**

**6. write more tutorials**

The Anti-Scam Response Team has come up with an initiative to incentivize community members to find and report to DNS registrars’ scam and phishing sites that plague the Polkadot ecosystem.

This initiative aims to make use of the sub-bounties pallet once it’s part of the runtime to issue rewards, but in the meantime, it is being tested out with a small number of participants and the rewards are issued with tips. This tip proposal is for such a reward.

This process has been revamped since this testing phase began and it’s described in detail in this **[Google form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf2iXCCvdkQ70WrfDPtG5uQA3RrCfvb0VDlZjti26q0yb17sg/viewform?usp=sf_link)** -  that is now the sole method of participating in the initiative.

However, the process has changed since it was first implemented and the most notable changes are:


•	A user could get a reward of 1 DOT for simply finding and reporting a scam site. Reporting it to the DNS registrar and (optionally) adding it to the GitHub phishing repo was a separate action with a separate reward.

•	The reward for filing a takedown request was 10 DOT split among all users who filed one before the site was taken down. This was soon changed to the more realistic 1 DOT per request, after a recommendation from the beneficiary of this tip:

Discord user **dubstard#0008 (15iZD84rHAjuvaiKXBj2YAEPRJ8Tt4VS1M79HsYhieTvtJR4)** has been doing excellent work since this initiative started: having found and taken down 11 sites single-handedly and reporting one more that is still live. Furthermore, he has provided valuable feedback that has helped improve the process during this testing phase and suggested other users that might be a good addition to the initiative. 

For all his efforts, we recommend that he receive the full 10 DOT for the three sites he took down single-handedly before the calibration of the rewards took place. We feel this is even more deserved if we also consider that he is an active member of the community, who for several months now finds, reports and takes down dangerous sites targeting users of our community.

Taking this into consideration and based on the reward amounts and the prerequisites as they were in each phase of this initiative, we propose that his tip is for the amount of 50 DOT. Taking into account the 20% finder’s fee, we recommend to the Council that the total amount of the tip is 62.5 DOT.

The proposed reward is analyzed below
![](https://i.imgur.com/yyscRL2.png)


**The curators of this initiative:**


•	**@ccris02#4626**: Discord moderator on the Polkadot server, Polkadot and Kusama validator and the submitter of this proposal

•	**@Michalis#6840**: Web3 Foundation employee and member of the Anti-Scam Report Team who leads this initiative

Attest that they have verified all the information submitted by the beneficiary based on the rules that applied at each time.

items.title: Maintenance for Stylo from Nov 2021 until June 2022
items.content:
This submission proposes a tip payment to cover maintenance costs for Stylo wallet, including general maintenance, runtime upgrades changes and infrastructure costs, along with any FTEs coverage needed. Since Stylo Wallet supports both Kusama and Polkadot Networks, this maintenance proposal alternates networks for submission every six months-ish. The last one was a KSM treasury proposal submitted 1 year ago [here](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/post/576).

This submission covers Nov 2021 until June 2022 - 8 months.

- Amount requested: 3,840.00 EUR (8 months), 358 DOT
- DOT rate: 11.55 USD/DOT - 10.72 EUR/DOT, using monthly avg from [Subscan Price Chart](https://polkadot.subscan.io/tools/charts?type=price).
- Beneficiary account: 123QQQwqdMQ5ZKqi2SxaTAV3TLpdfpYz6L5e5DqDXBzftMWT

Information on past upgrades, usage metrics, budget and timelines [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bINxPAgtVqrq6UDBFki_zNp_X7aVOppEEAkoxOSjcJQ/edit#).

items.title: Fixed an critical type decoding issue in subxt (rust substrate client)
items.content:
I spent a few days to [fix a critical bug in Subxt](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate-subxt/pull/221), which have been blocking 3 teams for a few months. Before this fix, Subxt randomly crashes when submitting transactions, and it almost always crash when scanning a long range of blocks for their events.

The Pull Request is already merged.

Background: **[subxt](https://github.com/paritytech/substrate-subxt)** is the official rust client of Substrate. It's widely used by Polkadot ecosystem projects to interact with Polkadot and parachains. My team, Phala Network also relies on it to build all our bridges.

Time spent: 8 hours development, testing, and code-review

items.title: For a series of translations and blogposts for the Russian community
items.content:
